bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to the Secretary of State, June 3, 1901

div1.p: Sternberg sends two copies of “The Etiology of Yellow Fever” to the Secretary of State for transmission to the Portuguese Minister.

div1.head: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to the Secretary of State, June 3, 1901
div1.p:
OFFICE OF THE SECRETARY
JUN 1
1536
1901
WAR DEPARTMENT
The Hon the Secty of State.

Requests two copies of
Surg. Gen's recent
circular dealing with
yellow fever, for trans-
mission to the Portuguese
minister.

REC'D JUN 1 - 1901
RECORD DIV.
WAR DEPT.

Read by the Surgeon General,
and Ordered filed [unclear]

Respectfully returned to the Hon-
orable the Secretary of War, enclos-
ing two copies of report on The Eti-
ology of Yellow Fever and copy of
Circular No. 5, from Headquarters,
Department of Cuba, dated April 27,
1901.

Geo. M. Sternberg
Surgeon General, U. S. Army.

REC'D
BACK
JUN 4 - 1901
RECORD DIV.
WAR DEP'T.

REC'D
BACK
JUN 5 - 1901
RECORD DIV.
WAR DEP'T.
